title: Reproduce APA&Co project analyses
text: aim repository allow understanding, reproduction, finally evaluation analytical pipeline implemented get results APA&Co project (ClinicalTrials.gov ID: NCT04732923). APA&Co project conducted observe change physical condition, physical activity, motivation physical activity coronary artery disease patients 1 year followed cardiac rehabilitation program. research project managed hospital center Cholet (France). repository four branches (master, gh-pages, docker, pipeline): master branch hosts content {APACo} package. content package includes datasets built data obtained measurements implemented APA&Co project. datasets actually censored versions original datasets limit access materials required understand results project. package also includes code (functions) developed analyse data project. code based R programming language. note, functions package written aim make easily reusable projects. said, one major function package, called analyse_change provides figures tables describing differences two marginal distributions paired data, developped may reused working similar data. gh-pages branch hosts files stands {APACo} package website. website contains Reference tab list datasets functions included package shown. item list briefly presents content datasets arguments considered function. want know computations {APACo} package functions implement, shoud go R/ folder master branch file contains code given function. docker branch contains code build Docker image push image Docker Hub repository. Docker image kind virtual environment, can configured needed, immutable. present case, Docker image includes R software (v4.3.1) version renv package. interest Docker image provide environment can sure analytical pipeline project work provide exactly results, ever. pipeline branch contains code runs analytical pipeline APA&Co project. pipeline, based targets package, organized sequence actions use datasets functions {APACo} package generate results embedded .tiff figures .html files. main interest pipeline automatically (non-interactively) drive analyses. important step ensure reproducibility analyses results. branch also contains R code uses renv package allow restoration package dependencies relating analytical pipeline, another step required ensure reproducibility analytical pipeline thus results. note, branch also hosts GitHub Actions workflow builds Docker image one hosted Docker Hub repository (described ) run installation package dependencies analytical pipeline, run analytical pipeline generates results APA&Co project. , workflow opens Docker container allows move results embedded .tiff/.html files present GitHub repository. may access files consulting last dockerized-pipeline workflow run. web page workflow click link workflow run (last one example, top list), conducted new web page Artifacts section contains created files embedded zipped folder. can finally download folder machine consult results worklow run since less 90 days.

what: How the content of this repository can be used to allow the reproduction of the analyses of the APA&Co project?
title: Reproduce APA&Co project analyses
text: suggest two approaches reproduce analyses APA&Co project: running analytical pipeline PC RStudio; running analytical pipeline PC Docker. two approaches advantages limits depending interested understanding reproducibility analyses.

what: Running the analytical pipeline on a PC with RStudio
title: Reproduce APA&Co project analyses
text: approach may interesting want explore, running analytical pipeline, content created objects content functions place, , present case, RStudio environment. However, main downside approach reproducibility fully garanteed. Indeed, success analytical pipeline run dependent various factors controlled content present repository, particular, current version R using, configuration system lives machine. , order reproduce analytical pipeline exactly performed get results project, Docker-based approach better, actually, far best. Anyway, want reproduce analytical pipeline machine using RStudio environment, please follow steps . Step 1: Install R (recommended versions: >= 4.1.0 <= 4.3.1), RStudio, latest version Rtools (Windows user) machine. retrieve previous releases R, can go Windows, Mac. Step 2: Go pipeline branch APACo repository click green button called Code. click Download ZIP. Step 3: Unzip zipped folder machine, open , double-click APACo.Rproj file open project RStudio. Step 4: Restore package dependencies project renv using following command line Console: may take time required packages downloaded web installed project directory. Step 5: Run analytical pipeline targets using following command line Console: last step produce objects relating analytical process. also generate materials (.html report main results, .tiff figures, .html file-based supplementary materials) deemed used scientific publication. materials take time built include several high resolution figures. list objects created analytical process shown Console ‘target’ expression. analytical pipeline ended, can read created object running targets::tar_read(OBJECT_NAME) Console. also can load object global environment running targets::tar_load(OBJECT_NAME) Console. can load created objects one go running targets::tar_load_everything() Console. .tiff figures .html files generated run analytical pipeline appear pipeline_out/ folder created root project folder processing phase. information computations actually performed behind scene, can open _targets.R file placed root project. file essentially includes list targets::tar_target() functions, name object created first argument, operations performed get object second argument. quick way looking code copy name function interest paste Console writing APACo::. example, analyse_change() function {APACo} package, run Console following command: APACo::analyse_change. Another way, provide confortable view code, go Github repository {APACo} package. files placed R/ folder contain code functions developped project.

what: Running the analytical pipeline on a PC with Docker
title: Reproduce APA&Co project analyses
text: Using Docker image robust approach reproducibly run analytical pipeline. Indeed, Docker image kind virtual environment settings can defined wanted analyses can performed developping analytical pipeline. Please follow steps use approach machine: Step 1: Install Docker Desktop machine. Step 2: Open Docker Desktop machine. Windows user, warning message indicating Docker Desktop requires newer WSL kernel version. suggested message, run command line wsl --update Command Prompt app (know, software shows window black background; afraid ). installation done, try open Docker Desktop. Step 3: Go pipeline branch APACo repository click green button called Code. click Download ZIP. Step 4: Unzip zipped folder machine open . Step 5: Open, unzipped folder, Command Prompt (Terminal Mac) app. , Windows user, inside unzipped folder (root), can simply write cmd address bar displayed top screen press Enter. , see Command Prompt window line beginning something like : example (appropriate Windows users), C:\Users\YOUR_USER_NAME\ stands current user session, Downloads\APACo-pipeline stands remaining part path unzipped folder named APACo-pipeline. may several folder names use path YOUR_USER_NAME APACo-pipeline depending placed unzipped folder machine. Mac user thus want open Terminal app unzipped folder, may try following recommendation: ‘easiest way open Terminal current folder Mac use Finder navigate location right-click open Terminal context menu. can also use Finder menu drag drop folders top Terminal application dock.’ (source ). want manually indicate Command Prompt (Terminal) app want work unzipped folder, can open Command Prompt (Terminal), run following command line replacing YOUR_USER_NAME actual user name Downloads/APACo-pipeline path unzipped folder (, C:/Users/ stands example Windows users): Step 6: Ensure internet connexion, build Docker image installation required package dependencies run analytical pipeline generates results, running following command line Command Prompt (Terminal) app (forget point end line): whole process may take several minutes consists downloading base Docker image (R v4.3.1 version renv r package), building new Docker image top downloading installing R package dependencies, finally running analytical pipeline R. Step 7: Create Docker container move files embedding results Docker volume machine, precisely folder named shared_folder inside unzipped folder named APACo-pipeline. , run following command line Command Prompt (Terminal) app: example (appropriate Windows users), C:/Users/YOUR_USER_NAME/Downloads/APACo-pipeline/shared_folder absolute path folder named shared_folder root unzipped folder named APACo-pipeline. previoulsy described, replace C:/Users/YOUR_USER_NAME/Downloads/ path fits needs. part code modify (assuming unzipped folder still named APACo-pipeline). Step 8: Finally, go shared_folder folder root unzipped folder (.e., inside APACo-pipeline folder). results embedded .tiff figures .html files . can now close Command Prompt (Terminal) app. presented approach principle robust reproduce analytical pipeline, downside approach can easily interact R explore content functions intermediate objects created get results (possible using additional command lines). However, sufficient knowledge R programming language, can infere content objects code shown master branch APACo repository.
code: C:\Users\YOUR_USER_NAME\Downloads\APACo-pipeline> cd C:/Users/YOUR_USER_NAME/Downloads/APACo-pipeline docker build -t apaco_image . docker run --rm --name apaco_container -v C:/Users/YOUR_USER_NAME/Downloads/APACo-pipeline/shared_folder:/project/shared_folder:rw apaco_image

Therefore, package dependencies installed workflow. Unfortunately, among package dependencies, two non-CRAN packages installed: rogme {APACo}. important two repositories host packages disappear web, may possible install workflow, run analytical pipeline fail. deletion two repositories unlikely, perform extra work build Docker image contain required materials interest persons time skills directly work image.

what: Get a set of figures and tables for analysing the change in the variable of interest — analyse_change
title: Get a set of figures and tables for analysing the change in the variable of interest — analyse_change
text: Get set figures tables analysing change variable interest

title: Get a set of figures and tables for analysing the change in the variable of interest — analyse_change
code: analyse_change(   data,   id,   x,   y,   rain_side = NULL,   nudge_y = NULL,   color_fill = NULL,   color_stat = NULL,   labs_1x = NULL,   labs_1y = NULL,   labs_2x = NULL,   labs_2y = NULL,   labs_3x = NULL,   labs_3y = NULL,   labs_4x = NULL,   labs_4y = NULL,   labs_5x = NULL,   labs_5y = NULL,   labs_6x = NULL,   labs_6y = NULL )

title: Get a set of figures and tables for analysing the change in the variable of interest — analyse_change
text: data data frame. id character value indicate name variable designating identities observations. x character value indicate name factor variable (2 levels) plotted X axis. y character value indicate name numeric variable plotted Y axis. rain_side character value indicate want rainclouds displayed, right ("r"), left ("l") flanking ("f"), 1--1 flanking raincloud use ("f1x1") 2--2 use ("f2x2"). nudge_y numeric value vertically move labels graphic showing shift function. color_fill character value set filling color. color_stat character value set color statistical summaries. labs_1x character string name X axis 1rst graphic (marginal distributions). labs_1y character string name Y axis 1rst graphic (marginal distributions). labs_2x character string name X axis 2nd graphic (pairwise differences). labs_2y character string name Y axis 2nd graphic (pairwise differences). labs_3x character string name X axis 3rd graphic (bivariate relationship). labs_3y character string name Y axis 3rd graphic (bivariate relationship). labs_4x character string name X axis 4th graphic (quantile shifts). labs_4y character string name Y axis 4th graphic (quantile shifts). labs_5x character string name X axis 5th graphic (shift function). labs_5y character string name Y axis 5th graphic (shift function). labs_6x character string name X axis 6th graphic (difference asymmetry function). labs_6y character string name Y axis 6th graphic (difference asymmetry function).

title: Get a set of figures and tables for analysing the change in the variable of interest — analyse_change
text: ggplot object.

title: Barriers to physical activity — BARRIERS
text: Participants responses questionnaire assessing barriers physical activity 12 months end cardiac rehabilitation program.

title: Barriers to physical activity — BARRIERS
text: data frame 77 rows 12 columns: patient Participant's ID. num_visit 1 = visit end cardiac rehabilitation program; 2 = visit 6 months post program; 3 = visit 12 months post program. trop_vieux "old"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". manque_interet "Lack interest"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". effort_import_fatig "Heavy effort / tired"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". manque_temps "Lack time"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". meteo_defavorable "Unfavourable weather"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". deplacements_diff "Difficulty move"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". cout_trop_eleve "costly"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". crainte_blessures_douleurs "Fear injury / pain"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". isolement_faible_RS "Social isolation / weak social network"; 1 = "yes"; 0 = "". autres "reasons". autre_precision_obstacle "details barriers".

title: Barriers to physical activity — BARRIERS
text: APA&Co project

Physical, clinical, and functional characteristics at the inclusion visit — INCLUSION
text: data frame 83 rows 8 columns: patient Participant's ID. age Age years. sex 1 = male; 2 = female. height Height cm. weight Weight kg. angioplasty 1 = angioplasty; 0 = angioplasty. bypas 1 = bypass surgery; 0 = bypass surgery. DIST_6WT_M0 6-min walking test distance m.

title: IPAQ-SF — IPAQ
text: Participants responses IPAQ-SF 0, 6 12 months end cardiac rehabilitation program.

title: IPAQ-SF — IPAQ
text: data frame 243 rows 13 columns: patient Participant's ID. num_visit 1 = visit end cardiac rehabilitation program; 2 = visit 6 months post program; 3 = visit 12 months post program. bloc1_q1 1 = participant engaged vigorous physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days; 0 = participant engage vigorous physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. bloc2_q2 Number days vigorous physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. total_hours_heavy Total time vigorous physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days (hours part); 999 = answer. total_minutes_heavy Total time vigorous physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days (minutes part); 999 = answer. bloc2_q1 1 = participant engaged moderate physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days; 0 = participant engage moderate physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. bloc2_q2 Number days moderate physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. total_hours_moderate Total time moderate physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days (hours part); 999 = answer. total_minutes_moderate Total time moderate physical activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days (minutes part); 999 = answer. bloc3_q1 1 = participant engaged walking activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days; 0 = participant engage walking activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. bloc3_q2 Number days walking activity (>= 10  min bouts) last 7 days. bouts_walk_7days Number (consecutive ) walking periods 10  min last 7 days; 9999 = answer.

title: IPAQ-SF — IPAQ
text: APA&Co project

title: Make a polished raincloud plot for visualising the change — view_rainclouds
code: view_rainclouds(   data,   id,   x,   y,   rain_side = NULL,   color_fill = NULL,   color_stat = NULL,   labs_x = NULL,   labs_y = NULL )

title: Make a polished raincloud plot for visualising the change — view_rainclouds
text: data data frame. id character value indicate name variable designating identities observations. x character value indicate name factor variable (2 levels) plotted X axis. y character value indicate name numeric variable plotted Y axis. rain_side character value indicate want rainclouds displayed, right ("r"), left ("l") flanking ("f"), 1--1 flanking raincloud use ("f1x1") 2--2 use ("f2x2"). color_fill character value set filling color. color_stat character value set color statistical summaries. labs_x character string name X axis. labs_y character string name Y axis.

title: Make a polished raincloud plot for visualising the change — view_rainclouds
text: ggplot object.
